title: Do you have time to play?
description: Learn how to ask if someone has time, or if someone is busy. Great for making plans.

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 小红，你最近忙不忙？
content.pinyin: Xiǎohóng, nǐ zuìjìn máng bù máng?
content.meaning: Xiaohong, are you busy recently?

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 和平时一样，不怎么忙，怎么了？
content.pinyin: Hé píngshí yīyàng, bù zěnme máng, zěnme le?
content.meaning: Same as usual, not very busy, why?

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 我最近开始喜欢打乒乓球，想找你一起打。
content.pinyin: Wǒ zuìjìn kāishǐ xǐhuān dǎ pīngpāngqiú, xiǎng zhǎo nǐ yīqǐ dǎ.
content.meaning: I recently started to like playing table tennis, I want to ask you to play together.

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 周六下午我有空，但还不会打乒乓球。
content.pinyin: Zhōuliù xiàwǔ wǒ yǒu kòng, dàn hái bù huì dǎ pīngpāngqiú.
content.meaning: I am free on Saturday afternoon, but I don't know how to play table tennis yet.

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 没关系，我可以教你。
content.pinyin: Méi guānxi, wǒ kěyǐ jiāo nǐ.
content.meaning: It doesn't matter, I can teach you.

title: What does your father do?
description: This Mandarin dialogue contains key sentence structures you’ll repeatedly hear in Chinese conversations. Remember to review articles often. It’s the secret to becoming fluent!

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 我爸爸昨天才回到家，他从新加坡给我带了礼物。
content.pinyin: Wǒ bàba zuótiān cái huídào jiā, tā cóng Xīnjiāpō gěi wǒ dài le lǐwù.
content.meaning: My dad just came home yesterday, he brought me a gift from Singapore.

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 为什么你爸爸前几天不在家？
content.pinyin: Wèishéme nǐ bàba qián jǐ tiān bù zài jiā?
content.meaning: Why was your dad not at home the last few days?

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 因为他出差了。
content.pinyin: Yīnwèi tā chūchāi le.
content.meaning: Because he was on a business trip.

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 你爸爸是干什么的？
content.pinyin: Nǐ bàba shì gànshénme de?
content.meaning: What does your father do?

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 他是一个公司的经理，经常不在家。
content.pinyin: Tā shì yī gè gōngsī de jīnglǐ, jīngcháng bù zài jiā.
content.meaning: He is a company manager, he is often not at home.

questions.question: 小明的爸爸什么时候回到家的？
小明的爸爸是干什么的？

title: What job do you want?
description: A HSK 1 Mandarin dialogue discussing what you want to become once you are older.

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 你以后想干什么？
content.pinyin: Nǐ yǐhòu xiǎng gànshénme?
content.meaning: What do you want to do in the future?

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 老师，我喜欢小孩儿，你呢？
content.pinyin: Lǎoshī, wǒ xǐhuān xiǎoháir, nǐ ne?
content.meaning: A teacher, I like children, and you?

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 我想当画家，可是我的妈妈不同意。
content.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng dāng huàjiā, kěshì wǒ de māma bù tóngyì.
content.meaning: I want to be a painter, but my mom doesn't agree.

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 为什么她不同意？
content.pinyin: Wèishéme tā bù tóngyì?
content.meaning: Why doesn't she agree?

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 她说当画家没钱，她希望我当商人。
content.pinyin: Tā shuō dāng huàjiā méi qián, tā xīwàng wǒ dāng shāngrén.
content.meaning: She says being a painter has no money, she hopes I become a businessman.

questions.question: 为什么小明的妈妈不同意他当画家？

title: Home for a day
description: A Chinese dialogue about heading home for a day. The dialogue continues at HSK 2 and HSK 3 level. The conversation has an informal tone.

content.speaker: 妈妈
content.chinese: 你回来了，我好想你！真开心啊。
content.pinyin: Nǐ huílái le, wǒ hǎo xiǎng nǐ! Zhēn kāixīn a.
content.meaning: You're back, I missed you so much! I'm so happy.

content.speaker: 我
content.chinese: 是啊妈妈，我也很想你。
content.pinyin: Shì a māma, wǒ yě hěn xiǎng nǐ.
content.meaning: Yes mom, I missed you too.

content.speaker: 妈妈
content.chinese: 你想吃什么？我去给你做饭。
content.pinyin: Nǐ xiǎng chī shénme? Wǒ qù gěi nǐ zuòfàn.
content.meaning: What do you want to eat? I'll go cook for you.

content.speaker: 我
content.chinese: 都可以，妈妈做的我都爱吃。妈妈，房间脏了，我扫一下地。
content.pinyin: Dōu kěyǐ, māma zuò de wǒ dōu ài chī. Māma, fángjiān zāng le, wǒ sǎo yīxià dì.
content.meaning: Anything is fine, I love everything mom cooks. Mom, the room is dirty, I'll sweep the floor.

content.speaker: 妈妈
content.chinese: 你刚回家，太累了，不用扫地，快去休息吧。
content.pinyin: Nǐ gāng huíjiā, tài lèi le, bùyòng sǎodì, kuài qù xiūxi ba.
content.meaning: You just got home, you're too tired, no need to sweep, go rest quickly.

questions.question: 回家的第一天，妈妈觉得怎么样？

title: Baidu
description: A short Chinese article about Baidu. It is China’s most popular search engine.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.chinese: “百度”是中国人最经常用的软件。百度，和谷歌差不多，可以用来提问，找图片，找视频等等。
content.pinyin: “Bǎidù” shì Zhōngguórén zuì jīngcháng yòng de ruǎnjiàn. Bǎidù, hé Gǔgē chàbùduō, kěyǐ yònglái tíwèn, zhǎo túpiàn, zhǎo shìpín děngděng.
content.meaning: “Baidu” is the software Chinese people use most often. Baidu is similar to Google, it can be used to ask questions, find pictures, find videos, etc.

content.speaker: Narrator
content.chinese: 我们常常说“百度一下，你就知道”，意思是，你有什么不懂的，在百度上都可以找到答案。
content.pinyin: Wǒmen chángcháng shuō “Bǎidù yīxià, nǐ jiù zhīdào”, yìsi shì, nǐ yǒu shénme bù dǒng de, zài Bǎidù shàng dōu kěyǐ zhǎodào dá'àn.
content.meaning: We often say “Baidu it, and you'll know”, meaning if there's something you don't understand, you can find the answer on Baidu.

questions.question: 百度不可以用来干什么？

title: Let’s go to the park
description: A Chinese dialogue about going to the park (公园). This conversation continues at a HSK 2 level.

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 小红，你星期六想去玩儿吗？还是你想在学校学习？
content.pinyin: Xiǎohóng, nǐ xīngqīliù xiǎng qù wánr ma? Háishì nǐ xiǎng zài xuéxiào xuéxí?
content.meaning: Xiaohong, do you want to go play on Saturday? Or do you want to study at school?

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 你想去哪里？
content.pinyin: Nǐ xiǎng qù nǎlǐ?
content.meaning: Where do you want to go?

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 星期六我们去公园吧，夏天来了，我们可以去游泳。
content.pinyin: Xīngqīliù wǒmen qù gōngyuán ba, xiàtiān lái le, wǒmen kěyǐ qù yóuyǒng.
content.meaning: Let's go to the park on Saturday, summer is here, we can go swimming.

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 好啊！
content.pinyin: Hǎo a!
content.meaning: Okay!

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 那星期六早上九点，我在学校门口等你。
content.pinyin: Nà xīngqīliù zǎoshang jiǔ diǎn, wǒ zài xuéxiào ménkǒu děng nǐ.
content.meaning: Then Saturday morning at 9 o'clock, I'll wait for you at the school gate.

title: Where do you come from?
description: One of the most common questions you will hear travelling around China is “Where are you from?” This might be “你是哪国人?” or “你来自哪里?”. Both are asking where you come from.

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 小红，你是英国人吗？
content.pinyin: Xiǎohóng, nǐ shì Yīngguórén ma?
content.meaning: Xiaohong, are you British?

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 我不是，我是美国人，你呢？
content.pinyin: Wǒ bù shì, wǒ shì Měiguórén, nǐ ne?
content.meaning: I am not, I am American, and you?

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 我是加拿大人，我爸爸是中国人，我妈妈是加拿大人。
content.pinyin: Wǒ shì Jiānádàrén, wǒ bàba shì Zhōngguórén, wǒ māma shì Jiānádàrén.
content.meaning: I am Canadian, my dad is Chinese, my mom is Canadian.

content.speaker: 小红
content.chinese: 哦，我们班也有一个加拿大人。
content.pinyin: Ò, wǒmen bān yěyǒu yī gè Jiānádàrén.
content.meaning: Oh, our class also has a Canadian.

content.speaker: 小明
content.chinese: 是吗？那下次我去找他玩儿。
content.pinyin: Shì ma? Nà xiàcì wǒ qù zhǎo tā wánr.
content.meaning: Really? Then next time I'll go find him to play.
